description: From Middle English aȝenseyere, equivalent to gainsay +‎ -er.

entries.meaning: One who contradicts or denies what is alleged; an opposer.
A person who gainsays others; a disagreeable person.
examples: First, The writer, positively asserts, "That Wood's halfpence were current among us for several months with the universal approbation of all people, without one single gainsayer".
